H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5383.def: = action with which a person gives money or something of value to another person with the expectation that it will be paid back or returned

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

16.gl: mother > place of origin and sustenance

54.gl: mother > place of origin and sustenance

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6304.def: literally: redemption; hence: = causative action by which deities help humans out of a dangerous, life-threatening, or otherwise difficult situation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H1606.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H2717.def: = process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H1710.def: = collective designation of various cold-blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food

H887.def: = process by which objects such as dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H6940.def: = state in which the sky is dark

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H3682.def: literally: covering; hence: = something that is a visible proof of someone else's innocence in a certain matter

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3928.def: = state in which animals have adapted themselves to the conditions of a certain environment

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5790.def: = process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3287.def: = state in which humans are weak as a result of an extended period of activity

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1460.def: = the rear part of the human body, especially from the neck to the bottom

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H4803.def: = process by which the human scalp loses hair

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H7536.def: = a watery liquid in the mouth, helping with chewing and swallowing; ≈ sometimes spit out in the direction of other people as an expression of disgust

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2496.def: = hard stone; ◄ consisting of nearly pure silica; ≈ symbol of a strong will-power

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H5066.def: = state in which objects are close to other objects in space

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H6211.def: = smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2825.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, and fear

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5051.def: = process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6919.def: = process by which a fire starts burning; ≈ used as a metaphor for anger

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H247.def: = to wear a belt or girdle around one's waist

H2131.def: = chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive ► in order to restrain their movements

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H217.def: = fire; ► used for burning sacrifices and other objects, setting fire to arrows, and warming oneself; ≈ associated with light, warmth, and destruction

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H4620.def: = process of a severe physical or mental suffering
